1.content:
The real story of how Jeff got to his anniversary gala starts the day before. As everyone knows, February 14th is also Valentine's Day, so in addition to all of his planning and preparation for the festivities on the 15th, he also has to make sure that he does V-Day right for his wife. Unfortunately, he has to work on Valentine's Day. Thoughtful as always, he arranged to have flowers delivered to his wife during the day, and plans on taking her out to dinner at her favorite classy seafood restaurant when he gets home from work. After dinner, he and his wife plan to share a quiet night at home and then he'll wake up on Friday ready to go to his anniversary gala.

But first, he has to get through Valentine's Day. His alarm goes off in the morning and he...

11.content:
Scribe arrived at his office at 7:00a.m.. As he settled in, he noticed his desk was a dumping ground as usual. As he tried to organize the work, his buzzer went off . His secretary, Ms. Phillips, sounded out of breath, She had Mr. David Lewis, the head of Women's Entertainment, on the line.

         "Mr. Scribe, Mr. Lewis is on the line."

         "Why are you out of breath, Patti?"

         "I was carrying something heavy, sir."

         "Put him on the line. Could you please call "The Lobster Barrel" and make a reservation for two for me at 8:30?"

         "Yes sir."

         "Hello David. Are you ready to make the deal on "Love's Awakening"?

         "I think we need to have a meeting about this, Scribe. If we're able to negotiate a deal, this could be bigger than "Cleopatra".

         "When do you want to meet, David?"

         "The only time I have available is this evening at 7:00. How about a dinner meeting at the Lobster Barrel?"

         "I have plans with my wife for this evening, David. Do you have time tomorrow?"

         "Scribe, I'm booked for the rest of the week. Do you want this movie or not? Your wife will understand."

         "I want this movie more than anything, David. Can I call you back?"

         "I'll be here until 2:00, Scribe. You have until then. I'll make us a reservation for two."

         "I'll call you by two, David. I really want this movie."

What will Scribe do?
11.title: Goes to work exactly as planned

choices: The restaurant is extra busy and the 7pm reservation has been pushed to 8pm
Scribe and David's wives 'run' into each other while waiting for their husbands
It's decided to do a combined meeting and Valentine's Date.
114.content:
Scribe already had his secretary make the necessary arrangements to take his wife to the same restaurant that David suggested, so he decided to agree to meet David first at 7:00pm and then he'd just have to figure out a good way to get his wife to the restaurant to meet him there rather than taking her himself as he originally planned.

         "Patti, call David back and let him know that I will meet him to discuss the movie tonight as he requested."

         "But sir, what are you going to do about the reservation you already made with your wife?"

         "If it wasn't Valentine's Day, I'd just suggest to my wife that he join us for our meal, but I can't really do that tonight. So instead, I'm thinking it might work out to meet with David first and maybe have a small appetizer, and then have drinks and the main part of the meal with my wife after the meeting is over.

         "In fact, why don't you also suggest that David bring his wife and they can dine together after we discuss a few things. Then he wouldn't expect me to stay and visit with him longer than I am able to.

         "Unless there is a problem with my suggestion for tonight with David, I'd appreciate you holding all my calls. I need to work out some things for my writing anniversary tomorrow. I have a lot of things to accomplish this afternoon before I leave to get ready for this evening."

         Later, as he was leaving for the day, Patti informed him that David agreed with his idea to invite his (David's) wife to the restaurant after their meeting was over.

         He left at his normal time to go home and get ready for his evening's activities.

What happens at the restaurant?

12.content:
But first, he has to get through Valentine's Day. His alarm goes off in the morning and he gets up to complete his morning ablutions just like any other day. Today there is a small twinkle in his eyes that speaks of mischief afoot, but he makes it to the bathroom before his wife gets a chance to see, or wonder about that brightness. A secret smile curves his lips as he works his fingers though his hair, massaging the scalp and shaking away the last lingering fog of sleep. Today will be a busy one, and there are still plans to finalize.

Once he finishes getting ready for the day, he gets the excitement under control and is able to go down to the breakfast nook without giving himself away. His wife is already there, her beauty makes him pause as the morning sunlight twines though her hair. She hasn’t seen him yet, her eyes dance over the text of the book she’s nearly finished and he feels his love rumble in his chest, a content lion curled around his heart.

This Valentine’s Day was one she would never forget. There isn’t time for him to linger over breakfast like he normally would, not if he wants to get everything in order. “I’m off my love, there’s a report due by the end of the day and I want to get it out of the way. I’ll see you tonight.”

As he walks past, she reaches out and snags his hand. With a fond smile, she brushes his knuckles against her cheek. “Tonight.” She agrees, even as he pulls her hand back and lays a soft kiss against the back of her hand. No more words need to be said, whole conversations are shared in the tilt of a head, the curve of familiar well-loved lips and expressive eyes.

He knows she suspects. But, even she won’t be able to guess his plans this time. Not after all the work he’s put into keeping it secret.

His first destination is the little flower shop tucked between a massive grocery store and strip mall. He’d found the shop a few years back, and while it was small, it had the best roses he’s ever seen.

First task, set up delivery of seven roses, each leading to the next destination. Once his wife finishes with one romantic task, another rose would be delivered directing her to the next. He has planned out the entire day, seven activities to show his love for her.

The bell chimes as he enters the shop and he is almost knocked over by the full bodied fragrance of roses.

Cam mixes up the letters and rose sequence, and sends up the wrong rose.
123.content:
The clerk in the shop was a coffee shade gypsy in a flowing white shirt. He looked up and down and snakes out his tongue to wet his parched lips.

Socal sighed. "Hey, Cam."

Cam came out with a big smile, his both hands spread out in the gesture of warm welcome. "Hullo, Handsome. After a long,long time. But you look hot as ever."

Socal shuffled on his feet in discomfort and mentally told her wife, "See, how much I have to suffer for your sake."
He turned towards the roses. They were shining in the recently splattered water-droplets, as if hoping to attract more customers with their dewy freshness. He found seven perfect buds of flowers from the crowd of flowers-- a white, yellow, red, orange, peach, pale pink, and at the last, he picked up an orchid.

Many other customers have entered and left the shop while he was deliberating over that perfect bud. He could feel their gaze raking him up and down and their laughter swirling around him. But he did not care. He would not sacrifice his wife's surprise because a bunch of kids who thought him too old for Valentine's day.

"Cam," he shouted as another kid looked at him.

"One moment, Handsome." His voice floated from around a small group hammering him for flowers.

Tapping his foot, he took out the cards he had already prepared and placed on each flower. A secret smile blossomed his face as he envisioned everything happening after that.

"The lady is going to get lucky tonight," Cam said as he passed him.

"I want these flowers delivered one at a time. The chits have the number on them and these are the letters with the numbers. You need to send them to my home in that sequence."

Cam's bushy eyebrows rose up. "You know handsome, I used to think that you have grown old and have lost your touch but I guess I was wrong. "

"Make sure they go in the sequence, else everything would be ruined. Start with the white flower first." He instructed once more, making the payment to Cam.

Cam winked.

Whistling he moved out to wait for his wife's reaction, once she receives his message. "Happy Valentine's Day," Cam's shout floated back to him.

141.content:
He picks up the slim piece of paper from the pillow and hastily opens it. His eyes scan the page in the dim light. It reads:

Dear husband,

It appears you have forgotten to spoil me rotten this morning as I feel I deserve. I hope this will be rectified this evening.

Your wife


"Oh no!" He groans and flops back onto the pillow. He feels his gut wrench. The thing is, he had planned to spoil her rotten. The croissants were hidden in the bread bin and the orange juice in the garage. He'd purchased her favourite coffee and planned to brew some before she woke so she would smell the aroma as soon as she rose. There was a single red rose hidden in the sleeve of his coat and a flower delivery was coming that morning too.

As if on cue, the door bell rang. Jumping from the bed, he rushed down the stairs almost tripping on his feet more than once and opened the door. It wasn't who he expected...
141.title: He sees a note on the pillow

144.content:
He leaps from his bed, still fuzzy from too much sleep and catches his foot in the bedclothes that are hanging down his side of the bed. He goes crashing down to the floor, his foot twisting beneath him, and loses half his flannel striped pyjamas on the way. He curses loudly rubbing his elbow, and then hops down the stairs on his one good foot holding onto the banister as he tries to pull his pants up with the other.

"What happened?" he says as he rounds the corner in to the kitchen, stil llimping a little. His wife is standing in the middle of the floor. He barely registers that she is wearing a red lace teddy, black fishnet stockings and very, very high heeled stillettos. His focus goes to her face, where her bottom lip is trembling and her eyes are filled with tears as she looks from him back down to the floor at the wooden tray, fluffy scrambled eggs and bacon strips mixed with orange juice, coffee and an assortment of broken crockery spread across the sparkling white tiles. His mother's crystal vase is smashed to pieces, the beautiful red roses strewn lying outstretched across what clearly was his Valentine breakfast.

His eyes slowly move from the floor, to the very high stillettos, up her ankles, her cute knees, takes in the stockings now on her still very shapely thighs, the perky little teddy, the swell of her breasts peeping over the top. He can take this two ways, he thinks wildly.... his mother's crystal vase, or that very sexy teddy.

As his wife sees him, she bursts into tears, and his heart - and body react. He steps forward to take her lovingly in his arms ...and steps onto a large, jagged shard of glass.
144.title: Something shatters on the floor in the kitchen

info.brief_description: Help tell the story of how SoCalScribe arrives at his 10th Anniversary Gala!
info.description:
On Friday, February 15, 2013, Jeff will celebrate his 10th Anniversary on Writing.Com. He's meticulously planned out "SoCalScribe's 10th Anniversary Gala"  and plans to throw a big day-long party on the site... but that's not the whole story! The really interesting part is his journey to the Anniversary Gala. Nothing is ever easy, and you wouldn't believe the stuff that happened to him on the way there! The premise of this Interactive Story is simple... help tell the story of what happened to Jeff on his way to the party!

TWO RULES:

1. Please adhere to the item rating and let's keep it good, (relatively) clean fun.
2. Please don't end a story branch too soon; make sure your contribution leaves plenty of options for others.
